block.p: Joanna Oltman, a daughter of Emmy Klein of Prather, Calif., and Theodore M. Oltman of Berkeley, Calif., was married yesterday to Ian Lynch Smith, a son of Patricia Lynch Smith and Sanford L. Smith, both of New York. The Rev. Judith A. Boggess, an interfaith minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Clermont State Historic Site in Germantown, N.Y.

Mrs. Smith, 30, was until this month a program administrator at the World Monuments Fund, an organization in New York that works to preserve historic buildings and other structures throughout the world. She graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in historic preservation from the University of Vermont. Her father is a carpenter in Berkeley.

Joanna Oltman, a daughter of Emmy Klein of Prather, Calif., and Theodore M. Oltman of Berkeley, Calif., was married yesterday to Ian Lynch Smith, a son of Patricia Lynch Smith and Sanford L. Smith, both of New York. The Rev. Judith A. Boggess, an interfaith minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony at the Clermont State Historic Site in Germantown, N.Y.

Mrs. Smith, 30, was until this month a program administrator at the World Monuments Fund, an organization in New York that works to preserve historic buildings and other structures throughout the world. She graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in historic preservation from the University of Vermont. Her father is a carpenter in Berkeley.

Mr. Smith, 29, owns Freeverse Software in New York. He graduated from Vassar. His mother manages the Smith Gallery, an antiques dealership in New York. His father produces art shows, including the Fall Antiques Show at the Seventh Regiment Armory in New York.
